curam.util.client.model

Interface ComponentBuilder<C extends Component>

  • Type Parameters:
    C - The type of component to build.
    All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ContainerBuilder, FieldBuilder

    public interface ComponentBuilder<C extends Component>
extends java.io.Serializable
    A builder for components. The builder simplifies the details of the construction process and ensures that an appropriate implementation of the component is provided. To use a builder, first call the methods to set the properties of the component or to add parameters to the component and then call ComponentBuilder.getComponent() to get the newly built component. The builder can also copy the properties of another component to the component to be built. A builder can be reused after each component has been built.

      • copy

        void copy(Component component)

        Copies the properties of the given component to the component being built. All properties are copied, even if they are null, and will overwrite any properties already set on the builder. However, parameters already added are not overwritten if there is no corresponding parameter in the component being copied.

        Different types of component may have different properties, so only the properties recognized by the component being built are copied from the given component. However, this may still be more than the basic properties defined by this interface.

        For components that contain other components, all contained components should also be copied. As components (one built) are immutable, copying references to the nested components is sufficient to meet this requirement.

        Parameters:
        component - The component to be copied. It is ignored if it is null.

      • copy

        void copy(Component component,
          java.lang.Object index)

        Copies the properties of the given component to the component being built and applies an index to the paths. All properties are copied, even if they are null, and will overwrite any properties already set on the builder. However, parameters already added are not overwritten if there is no corresponding parameter in the component being copied.

        Different types of component may have different properties, so only the properties recognized by the component being built are copied from the given component. However, this may still be more than the basic properties defined by this interface.

        For components that contain other components, all contained components should also be copied. As components (one built) are immutable, copying references to the nested components is sufficient to meet this requirement.

        For components that contain paths that may be indexed, the specified index will be applied. However, some components may not apply the index to all paths.

        Parameters:
        component - The component to be copied. It is ignored if it is null.
        index - The index to be applied to the component being built. If the index is specified as null, the component is still copied but any paths in that component remain unchanged.

      • setLinkTarget

        void setLinkTarget(Path linkTarget)
        Sets the link target for the link element. The link target is a path that resolves to the URI for the link. The target URI may contain a partial query string or may omit it. Additional parameters can be specified by calling ComponentBuilder.setLinkParameter(String, Path). Resolving the link target path will not automatically add the link parameters.
        Parameters:
        linkTarget - The path that resolves to the link target URI.

      • setLinkParameter

        void setLinkParameter(java.lang.String name,
                      Path sourcePath)
        Sets a link parameter to a path that will resolve to the parameter value. Link parameters will be added to the URI retrieved by resolving the link target path (see ComponentBuilder.setLinkTarget(Path).
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the parameter.
        sourcePath - The path that will resolve to the parameter value.

      • setConnector

        void setConnector(Path sourcePath,
                  Path targetPath)
        Sets the source path and the target path of a connector. The connector is added to the existing collection of connectors if at least one path is not null.
        Parameters:
        sourcePath - the path of the source.
        targetPath - the path of the target.
